etymology.description: Three parallel strokes; triplication of 一 (“one”). Compare 一, 二; unrelated to 丰.
etymology.interpretation: Three horizontal lines directly depict the quantity three, following the simple additive pattern of one and two. It is purely semantic with no phonetic component, visually stacking 'one' three times.

examples.chinese: 我有三个问题(我有三個問題)。
我们三点见(我們三點見)。
他住在三楼(他住在三樓)。
examples.english: He lives on the third floor.
